title: ‘I’m the brains behind Beyonce’s success’
text:
Email a friend 
BEYONCE’S publicity-hungry dad, Mathew Knowles, is setting the record straight about his daughter’s career. 
“I’m not just Beyonce’s father,” the record-label executive, who has managed a number of high-profile artists including Nas, told The New York Post . “People want to brand me as that. I’m the brains behind the success.” 
The 63-year-old also opened up about his upcoming daylong boot camp, The Entertainment Industry: How Do I Get In? 
“Let me tell you what it’s not — that I’m trying to cash out on Beyonce,” he said. “Nothing to do with that.” Guided her career ... Beyoncé Knowles and her father Matthew Knowles in London in 2007. Picture: Dave M. Benett/Getty Images Source: Supplied 
Despite his reassurance that he’s not profiting off his daughter, many interpreted the controversial seven-hour seminar — which promises to give key advice to aspiring singers, dancers, composers, writers, producers and even managers and lawyers — as a sign of desperation after Knowles severed business ties with Queen Bey in 2011. 
“[It’s the] same course, same price, that I gave in Barbados,” said the Music World Entertainment creator. “I’ve given similarities of the seminar in Paris. So it’s not something that’s new.” Family ... Beyoncé Knowles with her now-divorced parents Mathew and Tina Knowles in 2005. Picture: House of Dereon via Getty Images Source: Supplied 
He’s already got concrete plans to take his seminar to Georgia next month and upstate New York at the top of 2016. He’s also booking events in New York City, Washington DC, Baltimore and Virginia in the near future. 
“As an educator, most people don’t know, I taught for 10 years at the collegiate level. For eight years I’ve taught here in Houston at Texas Southern University,” he explained. “As an educator, this is what I do for a living. This seminar is just an extension of that.” Father, daughter flashback 
The seminar features a short video of Beyonce talking about failure. Despite no longer managing the 7/11 singer, Knowles added that his relationship with his superstar daughter remains positive. 
“I spent the day with Blue Ivy and Beyoncé a couple of months ago,” he said. “And actually hope to see them next week or the week after and spend another day doing Play-Doh with Blue Ivy.” Pop star ... Beyonce works her magic at the 2015 Global Citizen Festival in New York City. Picture: Theo Wargo/Getty Images for Global Citizen Source: Getty Images 
So far, he’s sold 300 of the available 500 tickets. Prices range from $US99 for students to $US299 for the VIP experience, which includes lunch with Knowles and a photo. 
All participants will get a certificate of completion and a reference book with a glossary of industry definitions and helpful contacts. Mother and daughter
